import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { FileText, Mail, Users, Brain, Database, Dna, Sun, Moon } from 'lucide-react'; import { Alert, AlertDescription } from './components/ui/alert'; import AcademicLinks from './components/AcademicLinks'; import PublicationList from './components/PublicationList'; import ProjectList from './components/ProjectList'; const PersonalPage = () => { // const [setCopiedIndex] = useState(null); const [darkMode, setDarkMode] = useState(false); const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false); // Update HTML class when dark mode changes useEffect(() => { if (darkMode) { document.documentElement.classList.add('dark'); document.body.style.backgroundColor = '#1a1a1a'; } else { document.documentElement.classList.remove('dark'); document.body.style.backgroundColor = '#ffffff'; } }, [darkMode]); return (

{/* Brief Bio Section at Top */}

Matilde Pato

Professor Adjunct at Polytechnic University of Lisbon | European University, Researcher at FIT/ISEL, IBEB-FCUL, LASIGE-FCUL and NOVALINCS.

{/* Two Column Layout */}
{/* Left Column */}
{/* Profile Content */}

Matilde Pato

Professor of Computer Science

DEETC of ISEL/IPL

{/* Contact Info */}

{/* Academic Links */}
{/* Right Column */}
{/* Brief Bio Section at Top */}

About Me

Matilde Pós-de-Mina Pato is an Adjunct Professor in the Department of Electronical Engineering, Telecommunications and Computers at the Lisbon School of Engineering, Polytechnic University of Lisbon | Ureka, and a senior researcher at IBEB and LASIGE (FCUL) and NOVA LINCS (FCT-UNL). With a multidisciplinary background in Biomedical Engineering and Computer Science, she conducts research at the intersection of Artificial Intelligence and Data Science. She has supervised and co-supervised several M.Sc. theses in Computer Science. She has co-authored dozens of papers in national and international journals and conference proceedings. Currently, she is part of the Management Committee of the COST ACTION Digital Mental Health for Young People (YouthDMH) in WG4 (Theory, Design and Implementation). She participates in European and national R&D projects with industrial partners and other universities and COST Actions. She participated in organising a Lecture-Style Tutorial on KDD 2021 entitled "Creating Recommender Systems Datasets in Scientific Fields". Furthermore, she has a talk where teachers and researchers can discuss computer science topics. Currently, her research focuses on Information Systems, AI in healthcare, Machine Learning, Recommender systems and Bioinformatics.

{/* Research Opportunities Alert */}

Looking for Research Collaborators!

I'm actively seeking passionate students and researchers interested in:

Information System
Artificial Intelligence
Machine Learning
Recommender Systems
Bioinformatics

If you're interested in pursuing research in these areas, please reach out via email to discuss potential collaboration opportunities, including PhD positions and research internships.

{/* Publications Section */}
{/* Projects Section */}
